meanings.definition: To guide or control the movement of a vehicle or animal in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: I will steer the boat towards the shore.
meanings.sent2: She used the reins to steer the horse along the trail.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to steer his toy car around the obstacles.
meanings.sent4: Her advice helped steer me in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse helped sailors steer clear of the rocks.

meanings.definition: A male bovine animal that has been castrated and is raised for beef production.
meanings.sent1: The farmer had a large herd of steers on his ranch.
meanings.sent2: The steer grazed peacefully in the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The steer seemed to enjoy the sunny weather in the field.
meanings.sent4: The steer's meat would soon be sold at the market.
meanings.sent5: The steer's horns were impressive in size.
